text: {"grade": 1, "reasoning": "The criterion requires highlighting the legal uncertainty regarding the specific status of AI training on publicly available scraped data. The candidate answer directly addresses this uncertainty by discussing the UK's Text and Data Mining (TDM) exceptions (s.29A/29B) and noting that the issue is currently being tested in court (citing *Getty v Stability AI*). It explicitly states that the application of these exceptions to commercial training is uncertain ('Maybe, but only if they had lawful access...'). This clearly satisfies the requirement to highlight the legal uncertainty surrounding AI training data scraping.", "criterion_id": "6abbced2-84de-41fc-9ca0-408a172a947c"}
